titleStmt.title: Eclogarius, or briefe summe of the truth of that title of Supreame Governour given to his Maiestie in causes spirituall, and ecclesiasticall, from the Kings of Israel, in the old Testament; the Christian emperours in the Primitive Church; confirmed by 40. epistles of Leo the Bishop of Rome, vnto the Emperours, Theodosius, Martianus, and Leo. Not published before. By Iohn Panke.
titleStmt.author: Panke, John.

titleStmt.title: Eclogarius, or briefe summe of the truth of that title of Supreame Governour given to his Maiestie in causes spirituall, and ecclesiasticall, from the Kings of Israel, in the old Testament; the Christian emperours in the Primitive Church; confirmed by 40. epistles of Leo the Bishop of Rome, vnto the Emperours, Theodosius, Martianus, and Leo. Not published before. By Iohn Panke.
titleStmt.author: Panke, John.

notesStmt.note: Running title reads: The truth of the oath of supremacy.
Imperfect; lacks quire E and all after page 88; trimmed at head, affecting headline.
Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
